title: What is React?
answer_1: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
answer_2: A programming language for server-side development.
answer_4: A styling framework for web applications.
right_answer: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

title: What are components in React?
answer_1: Reusable code blocks that represent parts of a user interface.
answer_3: Database tables that store application data.
answer_4: JavaScript functions that manipulate the DOM.
right_answer: Reusable code blocks that represent parts of a user interface.

title: What is JSX?
answer_1: A syntax extension for JavaScript that allows writing HTML-like code in React components.
answer_2: A package manager for React applications.
answer_3: A version control system for React projects.
answer_4: A testing framework for React components.
right_answer: A syntax extension for JavaScript that allows writing HTML-like code in React components.

title: What is the purpose of state in React?
answer_1: To store and manage data within a React component.
answer_2: To define the structure of a React component.
answer_3: To handle user events in a React component.
answer_4: To apply styles to a React component.
right_answer: To store and manage data within a React component.

title: What is the role of props in React?
answer_1: To pass data from a parent component to a child component.
answer_2: To define the initial state of a React component.
answer_3: To handle form submissions in a React component.
answer_4: To apply CSS styles to a React component.
right_answer: To pass data from a parent component to a child component.

title: What is the purpose of componentDidMount() lifecycle method in React?
answer_1: To update the state of a React component.
answer_2: To render the initial structure of a React component.
answer_3: To perform side effects after the component has been rendered.
answer_4: To handle user interactions in a React component.
right_answer: To perform side effects after the component has been rendered.

title: What is the significance of keys in React lists?
answer_1: To define the layout of a React component.
answer_2: To optimize the rendering performance of a React component.
answer_3: To handle user inputs in a React component.
answer_4: To track the identity of each component in a list for efficient updates.
right_answer: To track the identity of each component in a list for efficient updates.

title: What is Redux in React?
answer_1: A server-side rendering framework for React.
answer_2: A styling library for React components.
answer_3: A state management library for React applications.
answer_4: A testing framework for React components.
right_answer: A state management library for React applications.

title: What is the purpose of React Router?
answer_1: To handle asynchronous operations in React components.
answer_2: To manage form submissions in React applications.
answer_3: To handle client-side routing in React applications.
answer_4: To apply animations to React components.
right_answer: To handle client-side routing in React applications.

title: What are React hooks?
answer_1: Functions that enable stateful logic in functional components.
answer_2: Utility classes for styling React components.
answer_4: Event handlers for user interactions in React components.
right_answer: Functions that enable stateful logic in functional components.
